sub_topic: Preparation of 2,4-dichlorobenzoic acid from benzoic acid and chlorine gas
message_1: What amount of benzoic acid (in grams) and chlorine gas (in mL) will be required to synthesize 25 grams of 2,4-dichlorobenzoic acid with a yield of 80%?
message_2:
To solve this problem, we need to first determine the balanced chemical equation for the reaction between benzoic acid and chlorine gas to produce 2,4-dichlorobenzoic acid. The balanced equation is:

C6H5COOH + 2 Cl2 → C6H3Cl2COOH + 2 HCl

Next, we need to determine the molecular weights of the reactants and product:

Benzoic acid (C6H5COOH): 12(6) + 1(5) + 16 + 16(1) = 122 g/mol
Chlorine gas (Cl2): 35.45(2) = 70.9 g/mol
2,4-dichlorobenzoic acid (C6H3Cl2COOH): 12(6) + 1(3) + 35.45(2) + 16 + 16(1) = 197 g/mol

Now, we need to determine the theoretical yield of 2,4-dichlorobenzoic acid:

25 g (actual yield) / 0.80 (yield percentage) = 31.25 g (theoretical yield)

Next, we will use stoichiometry to determine the amount of benzoic acid and chlorine gas required:

For benzoic acid:
(31.25 g 2,4-dichlorobenzoic acid) x (1 mol benzoic acid / 1 mol 2,4-dichlorobenzoic acid) x (122 g benzoic acid / 1 mol benzoic acid) = 19.53 g benzoic acid

For chlorine gas:
(31.25 g 2,4-dichlorobenzoic acid) x (2 mol Cl2 / 1 mol 2,4-dichlorobenzoic acid) x (70.9 g Cl2 / 1 mol Cl2) = 44.28 g Cl2

Now, we need to convert the mass of chlorine gas to volume. The density of chlorine gas at room temperature (25°C) and atmospheric pressure (1 atm) is approximately 3.2 g/L.

(44.28 g Cl2) x (1 L / 3.2 g) x (1000 mL / 1 L) = 13,837.5 mL Cl2

So, to synthesize 25 grams of 2,4-dichlorobenzoic acid with a yield of 80%, you will need 19.53 grams of benzoic acid and 13,837.5 mL of chlorine gas.
